column2: FLORIDA DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: Florida
column6: FL

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This sign means:
column4: Vehicles may only turn left.
column6: Left turns in both directions of travel are not permitted.
column8: The center lane is shared for left turns.

column2: 2. A solid yellow line to the right of a broken yellow center line means:
column4: you are on a shared lane.
column6: passing or crossing is prohibited in that lane, except when turning left.
column8: drivers are traveling on reversible lanes.
column10: vehicles may cross these lines when changing lanes.

column2: 3. When you are stopped by a law enforcement officer you should:
column4: pull off to the extreme left.
column6: pull off to the extreme right.
column8: increase your speed to avoid being arrested.
column10: decrease your speed as you may be driving too fast.

column2: 4. If traffic on the other side of an intersection is backed up and you cannot get completely through, you must:
column4: enter the intersection and try to avoid blocking it.
column6: wait until traffic ahead is clear.
column8: enter the intersection and proceed with caution.
column10: turn right instead of going straight through the intersection.

column2: 5. The 2 red taillights mounted on the rear of a vehicle must be visible from ____ feet.
6. Which of the following is NOT a defensive driving tip:
column4: It is better to swerve right instead of toward oncoming traffic to prevent a crash.
column6: Hitting a row of bushes is better than hitting a tree.
column8: It is better to hit a vehicle moving toward you instead of something that is not moving.
column10: It is better to drive off the road than skid off when avoiding a crash.

column2: 7. When a pedestrian is crossing a public street and the pedestrian is using a crutch, drivers must:
column4: turn off the ignition.
column6: shift to a lower gear.
column8: show empathy.

column2: 8. If a traffic officer signals you to drive through a red light:
column4: you must wait for the red light to turn green.
column6: you must do it.
column8: you must not obey the officer. Signs and signals take precedence over directions given by traffic officers.

column2: 9. If a driver triples the speed of a car, he/she increases its force of impact:
column4: 4 times.
column6: 6 times.
column8: 9 times

column2: 10. Restricted lanes are usually reserved for:
column4: bikes during week-ends.
column6: cars in school or work zones.
column8: vehicles in one-way streets.
column10: car-pool vehicles or buses during rush hour traffic.

column2: 11. When the gas pedal is jammed, drivers should NOT:
column4: use their brakes.
column6: try to pry the pedal up with the toe of their shoe.
column8: turn off the ignition.
column10: turn the steering wheel hard in one direction.

column2: 12. Which of the following is NOT a guideline for driving at night:
column4: Use headlights between the hours of sunset and sunrise.
column6: Don’t look directly at oncoming headlights.
column8: Use high beams when you are within 100 feet of the vehicle ahead.
column10: If you are leaving a brightly lit place, drive slowly until your eyes adjust to the darkness.

column2: 13. If you double the speed of a car, the amount of kinetic energy in a crash:
column4: doubles.
column6: stays the same.
column8: triples.

column2: 14. Which of the following can be dangerous:
column4: Driving when you are ill.
column6: Driving while eating and drinking.
column8: Driving while drowsy.

column2: 15. To lower the risk of someone running into the rear of their vehicle, drivers should NOT:
column4: signal in advance for turns and lane changes.
column6: stop suddenly.
column8: check brake lights often to make sure they are clean.

column2: 16. Perception distance is:
column4: how far a vehicle travels, in ideal conditions, from the time the driver sees a hazard until his/her brain recognizes it.
column6: how long it takes a driver to physically hit the brakes.
column8: how far a drunk person can travel before coming to a complete stop in response to a hazard ahead.
column10: how far a driver will continue to travel, in ideal conditions; before he/she physically hits the brakes.

column2: 17. How many feet does a car need to be parked away from an intersection?
18. On some interstate roads, diamond signs in the median indicate that:
column4: there is a warning sign ahead.
column6: there is a railroad crossing ahead.
column8: passing is not allowed.
column10: the left lane is reserved for car pool vehicles.

column2: 19. If you are driving on a slippery road in a car with anti-lock brakes, how do you make an emergency stop?
column4: Press down hard on the brake pedal, hold it down, and steer out of danger.
column6: Pump the brakes to turn off the Anti-Locking Brake System.
column8: Remove steady pressure from the brake pedal.

column2: 20. If you are involved in a crash where you are at fault and do not have the required insurance to comply with the Financial Responsibility Law, your driver license and/or license plates will be suspended for up to:
column4: 2 years.
column6: 1 year.
column8: 3 years.

column2: 21. High beam headlights can reveal objects up to a distance of  ____ feet.
22. When driving in the fog, rain, or smoke in the daytime, what lights should drivers use?
column4: Low beam lights.
column6: High beam lights.
column8: Emergency flashers.
column10: None of the other answers are correct.

column2: 23. If a car approaches you with bright headlights, you must _________________ to prevent being temporarily blinded.
column4: come to a complete stop
column6: double your speed
column8: look toward the right edge of the road

column2: 24. How many feet to the rear should a driver be able to see objects through the rearview mirror?
25. Where are yield signs usually placed?
column4: Where auxiliary roads lead into major roads.
column6: At intersections, if there is no marked stop line.
column8: Where major roads lead into  auxiliary roads.

column2: 26. Is this car legally parked?
column4: No, vehicles cannot be parked in front of a fire hydrant.
column6: Yes, but only if it has parking lights on.
column8: Yes, if it is within 15 feet of the fire hydrant.
column10: Yes, vehicles can be parked within 10 feet of a fire hydrant.

column2: 27. If you are impatient, you should:
column4: speed up to avoid being late.
column6: adjust the radio while driving and select some relaxing music.
column8: have a beer or two.
column10: give yourself extra time for your driving trip.

column2: 28. What is the meaning of blue traffic signs?
column4: They give directional information.
column6: A blue background indicates a regulatory sign.
column8: Blue indicates road user services.
column10: Blue indicates pedestrian crossings and school zones.

column2: 29. Total stopping distance is:
column4: how far a vehicle will travel, in ideal conditions, while the driver is braking.
column6: the sum of perception distance, reaction distance and braking distance.
column8: the sum of reaction distance and braking distance, minus perception distance.

column2: 30. Leaving the scene of a crash involving a death commits a felony of the ____ degree.
column4: second
column6: third
column8: fourth

column2: 31. This sign means:
column4: You can only park between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column6: Parking is not allowed at 8:30 AM and at 5:30 PM
column8: No parking between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.

column2: 32. When approached by an emergency vehicle on a roundabout, drivers should:
column4: pull to the right and use your emergency flashers to signal that you are about to stop.
column6: immediately come to a complete stop.
column8: follow the emergency vehicle.
column10: continue on and exit the roundabout as normal, then pull to the right.

column2: 33. ____________ happens when a layer of water prevents direct contact between tires and the road, causing a loss of control.
column4: Indirect-planing
column6: Hydroplaning
column8: Tyre-planing

column2: 34. Your license can be suspended if:
column4: your license was issued in error.
column6: you are found guilty of lying about the ownership or operation of motor vehicles.
column8: you refuse to take a test to show if you are driving while under the influence of alcohol or drugs.
column10: you are found guilty of 3 cases of reckless driving within one year.

column2: 35. When the light is green, drivers should:
column4: go, but only if the intersection is clear.
column6: yield to pedestrians and vehicles still in the intersection.
column8: wait for a gap in oncoming traffic to complete a left turn.

column2: 36. Tampering with pollution control devices can cause:
column4: reduced air pollution.
column6: more maintenance costs.
column8: improved vehicle efficiency.

column2: 37. Cars A and B reach the intersection at the same time. Which of the following is correct?
column4: Car B must yield.
column6: Car A must yield.
column8: The vehicle on the right yields to the vehicle on the left.

column2: 38. A 4-way stop sign means:
column4: There are four stop signs at the intersection.
column6: Traffic from all four directions must stop.
column8: The first vehicle to reach the intersection should move forward first.

column2: 39. Gauging the speed of a motorcycle may be difficult because:
column4: motorcycles often slow down by downshifting.
column6: many motorcyclists do not activate the brake light.
column8: motorcycles take up less of your field of vision.

column2: 40. What should drivers do when they see this sign?
column4: Merge left.
column6: Look to the left and right for other traffic.
column8: Make sure the bridge is clear of oncoming traffic before they cross.

column2: 41. You must complete a basic driver improvement course if you want to retain your driver license when:
column4: you had two crashes in a 2-year period, resulting in property damage greater than $1,500.
column6: you were convicted of racing on highway.
column8: you are convicted of running a red light.

column2: 42. Who must obey traffic signals?
column4: Drivers and bicycle riders, but not pedestrians.
column6: Only law enforcement officers.
column8: Drivers, pedestrians, and bicycle riders.

column2: 43. Vehicles may travel in lanes beneath the green arrow signal, but drivers must:
column4: never change lane.
column6: prepare to leave the lane safely.
column8: also obey all other signs and signals.

column2: 44. Which of the following is NOT true about roundabouts?
column4: They improve traffic flow.
column6: Traffic signals found at roundabouts reduce traffic crashes.
column8: They slow vehicle speed.

column2: 45. Mature drivers should:
column4: drink coffee while driving.
column6: tap the horn at least three seconds before a traffic light becomes red.
column8: anticipate danger.
column10: get power steering to swing wide on turns.

column2: 46. When leaving an expressway, drivers should:
column4: get into the entrance ramp.
column6: get into the acceleration lane.
column8: get into the exit lane.
column10: make a last-minute turn into the exit.

column2: 47. The seat belt law does NOT exempt from the seat belt requirements:
column4: Employee of a newspaper home delivery service while delivering newspapers on home delivery routes.
column6: Front seat passengers under the age of 18.
column8: Farm equipment.

column2: 48. What should you do when preparing to turn right on a roadway with a bike lane?
column4: Check for and yield to bicyclists coming from the opposite direction.
column6: Cross the bike lane and then yield to any bicyclist in the bike lane.
column8: Signal your turn and yield to any bicyclist in the bike lane.

column2: 49. If you are in a crash while driving, your responsibilities include:
column4: attain vehicle, witness and driver information.
column6: helping the injured.
column8: sketching the scene.

column2: 50. This sign means:
column4: Divided highway ends.
column6: Keep to the left.
column8: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.
